page.title: 03CUSTOMS
page.content: Pannage. The Forest Law allows commoners living in certain properties to turn out their pigs for grazing on acorns. The common right of pasture applies to ponies,pigs, donkeys and cattle. Smugglers. It is said that the "Royal Oak" Fritham was used by smugglers when "free trade"reached its height in the 1700's when duty was so high. In the mid C18th a smuggler called David Smith betrayed his fellow smugglers in return for a free pardon promise-some were caught- the others caught Smith at Studley Bottom where his tongue was cut out, he was beaten and hanged on what is now called Deadman's Hill.
